messages.message:
Hey neighbour :3 If we put our minds to it, we can either work amazingly together this game or flail pointlessly at one another while other powers rise and rise (and rise). 

I’d really like to work towards option one, so let’s agree not to attack each other between Ven - Tri? At least not this year? We have more important things to do.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Hey neighbour :3 If we put our minds to it, we can either work amazingly together this game or flail pointlessly at one another while other powers rise and rise (and rise). 

I’d really like to work towards option one, so let’s agree not to attack each other between Ven - Tri? At least not this year? We have more important things to do.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's proposal to uphold a non-aggression pact between Venice and Trieste for the current year showcases a collaborative and forward-thinking approach within the alliance, emphasizing the importance of unity and focus on more significant strategic objectives. This commitment to cooperation sets a positive tone for the alliance and aligns with the goal of working together effectively to tackle common threats and challenges in the game.

messages.message:
Fairly conventional openings all around really, unless you’re concerned by A Gal. I see either you or Turkey could deny Greece to the other, but if you move in you lose Serbia as a build.
